instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
Hi,

I got this board, water on the right side, not on CPU side, corrosion on recto/verso.

I get 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.27
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> = 0V


Thanks
Sam

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
"water on the right side"
Audio board affected by corrosion on both sides?
Also check audio flex and connectors.

Post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
Thanks. By right side, I meant on USB-C connector side. nothing on audio/jack board

Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> = 0.400

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U6960</CHIP> basic voltage; pins 11, 12, 10, 13.
Use surrounding components as test points.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message: Thanks. One cap is shorted. I'll replace it.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
Hello,

Ok, I've replaced all shorted cap.

<CHIP>U6960</CHIP>  10, 11 & 12  = 12.29V   
              13 = 0V

Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
Thank you, was short. I don't see the value of that resistor. How can I know what resistor I can take to replace it ?

btw I've read another poste to check if T2 is still ok, <RESISTOR>R6401</RESISTOR> (PIN1) <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, diode mode to GND =0.351, that mean T2 should be ok.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
"was short"
What was short?
The resistor itself MUST be short (between its pins); is 0 ohm resistor!

Do you get voltage on its both pins?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
I get 0 V. Where can I see it's a 0 ohm resistor, need another schematic?

[ATTACH type="full"]60573[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damage, 5v- loop 54 -0 54 ma
threads.message:
Missing enable signal.
May have a problem with <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; try changing it.

The resistor value is marked on the schematic...
